text: Claire Lee Chennault (September 6, 1893 - July 27, 1958)Birthdate: Encyclopedia Britannica Ultimate Reference Suite 2010 and www.af.mil/About- Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107526/major-general-claire-lee-chennault/ give 1890 as birthyear was an American military aviator. He was best known for his leadership of the "Flying Tigers" and the Republic of China Air Force in World War II. Chennault was twice married and had a total of ten children. From 1947 until his death in 1958, he married Chinese reporter Anna Chennault. Chennault was promoted to lieutenant general in the U.S. Air Force on July 18, 1958, nine days before his death on July 27, at the Ochsner Foundation Hospital in New Orleans.Byrd 1987, p. 367. He died of lung cancer in New Orleans, Louisiana on July 27, 1958 at the age of 64. ==References== ==Other websites== *Flying Tigers Memorial in China (in Chinese) *Short biography of Chennault * *Chennault at Arlington Cemetery *Time magazine , 1942 article on Chennault *Claire Lee Chennault papers at the Hoover Institution Archives Category:1893 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Louisiana Category:Burials at Arlington National Cemetery Category:Anti-communists Category:American aviators Category:American Protestants Category:American military personnel of World War I Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Military people from Texas Category:People from Louisiana
